name: Blue Line Terminus West
design_style: Low-profile prairie-style architecture with native grass landscaping and copper-finished canopies
features: Platform shelters designed to blend with the natural horizon line
Integrated regional bike path connector with solar-powered charging stations
A 'First & Last Mile' plaza featuring ride-share waiting zones and local shuttle bus integration
Digital kiosks displaying local trail conditions and wildlife migration information
function: Westernmost anchor of the Blue Line, serving expanding residential communities and providing a gateway to regional parks and nature reserves.

neighborhood.name: Prairie Ridge Commons
neighborhood.vibe: Expansive, family-oriented, and connected to nature—where suburban life meets open skies.

landmarks.name: Horizon Park
landmarks.type: Vast natural parkland with walking trails, picnic areas, and a dedicated stargazing field

landmarks.name: The Trailhead Market
landmarks.type: Local café and outfitter shop serving commuters and park visitors

micro_neighborhoods.name: Switchgrass Meadows
micro_neighborhoods.style: Modern single-family homes with large yards and community gardens
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Kids' bicycles on sidewalks, weekend community sports leagues, wide-open sunsets

micro_neighborhoods.name: Copper Ridge Townhomes
micro_neighborhoods.style: Contemporary townhomes with shared green spaces and direct trail access
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Morning joggers, neighborly conversations over low fences, organized community events

name: River View Station
design_style: Elevated platform with timber decking and panoramic glass walls offering unobstructed river views
features: Telescope installations for bird watching and viewing river activity
A cantilevered observation deck extending towards the river
Public art featuring kinetic sculptures that move with the river breeze
Direct access ramp to the city's main riverfront recreational path
function: A picturesque stop providing access to riverside recreation and residential areas with stunning natural beauty.

neighborhood.name: Riverbend Bluffs
neighborhood.vibe: Calm, scenic, and active—a community defined by its relationship with the water.

landmarks.name: Riverfront Trail & Pier
landmarks.type: Popular recreational trail for cycling and walking, with a public fishing pier

landmarks.name: The Heron's Nest Café
landmarks.type: Riverside café with a patio offering breakfast and lunch with a view

micro_neighborhoods.name: Bluffside Terraces
micro_neighborhoods.style: Modern condos and apartments with balconies overlooking the river
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Early morning kayaking, sunset watching from balconies, a strong sense of community around outdoor activities

name: Chancellor Hills Shopping Center
design_style: Modern, open-air design integrated directly with the shopping mall's entrance, featuring extensive glass and steel elements
features: A covered walkway leading directly into the mall's main concourse
Digital advertising screens showcasing mall events and sales
A large, well-lit bus plaza for easy transfers
Art installations sponsored by the mall's flagship stores
function: A major hub for retail, dining, and entertainment, connecting shoppers from across the city.

neighborhood.name: Chancellor Hills
neighborhood.vibe: Busy, consumer-focused, and convenient—the epicenter of the city's retail scene.

landmarks.name: Chancellor Hills Mall
landmarks.type: Large indoor shopping mall with anchor department stores, a cinema, and a food court

landmarks.name: The Restaurant Row
landmarks.type: A collection of chain and local restaurants surrounding the mall

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Courtyards at Chancellor
micro_neighborhoods.style: Gated community of garden-style apartments and townhomes
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Quiet and orderly, with a focus on convenience and proximity to shopping and work

name: Gold Town West
design_style: Victorian-inspired platform shelters with ornate ironwork and gaslight-style lamps, reflecting the area's historic mining past
features: Historic plaques detailing the neighborhood's gold rush history
Platform benches made from reclaimed wood from historic buildings
A community message board styled like an old-timey bulletin board
Cobblestone-style platform paving
function: Serves a charming historic district known for its boutiques, antique shops, and unique character.

neighborhood.name: Old Gold Town
neighborhood.vibe: Historic, charming, and boutique—a neighborhood that treasures its unique past.

landmarks.name: The Main Vein Market
landmarks.type: A street of historic storefronts now occupied by antique shops, art galleries, and local eateries

landmarks.name: Gold Town Museum
landmarks.type: A small museum showcasing artifacts from the city's mining era

micro_neighborhoods.name: Prospector's Row
micro_neighborhoods.style: Restored Victorian-era homes and colorful townhouses
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Quiet, tree-lined streets, a strong sense of historic preservation, and community walking tours

name: Central Station
design_style: Cathedral-scale transit hall with arched glass vaults
features: Interactive ceiling map of Summit's transit evolution
Terraced ticketing concourse with sculptural light columns
Surround-sound boarding alerts in multiple languages
Dining promenade with micro-kitchens from all districts
function: Summit City's main light rail interchange and civic showcase. The bustling heart of the city's public transport network.

neighborhood.name: Civic Plaza Core
neighborhood.vibe: Monumental, multicultural, and perpetually in motion.

landmarks.name: Summit Grand Hall
landmarks.type: Civic event venue and historical monument

landmarks.name: Transit Dome Theater
landmarks.type: 360° immersive cinema for city heritage and arts

executive_towers.name: Vista Terraces
executive_towers.style: Stepped glass terraces with botanical courtyards
features: Sky bridges to adjacent retail towers
Transit concierge service

name: Downtown East
design_style: Sleek, minimalist design with polished granite floors, glass-paneled walls, and integrated digital art displays
features: Direct underground walkway connections to several major corporate office towers
A 'commuter lounge' with workspaces and charging stations
Rotating exhibits on the history of Summit City's founding businesses
Express elevators leading to a street-level plaza with high-end coffee shops
function: Serves the eastern flank of the downtown business district, catering to corporate professionals and residents of upscale towers.

neighborhood.name: Founder's District
neighborhood.vibe: Polished, professional, and fast-paced—where business deals and high-end city living converge.

landmarks.name: Summit Commerce Tower
landmarks.type: A landmark skyscraper housing the headquarters of several major corporations

landmarks.name: Plaza of the Founders
landmarks.type: A public plaza with fountains and statues dedicated to the city's industrial pioneers

executive_towers.name: The Founder's Residences
executive_towers.style: A luxury residential tower with premium amenities and direct access to corporate offices
features: 24/7 concierge and security
Rooftop pool and fitness center
Integrated smart home technology

name: Art District
design_style: Industrial-chic with exposed brick, polished concrete floors, and track lighting, designed to feel like a contemporary art gallery
features: Rotating murals and art installations from local artists on platform walls
Performance spaces for street musicians and performance artists
Digital screens displaying information on local gallery openings and theater shows
Wayfinding signage designed by local graphic artists
function: The heart of Summit City's vibrant arts scene, serving numerous galleries, theaters, and performance venues.

neighborhood.name: Gallery Row
neighborhood.vibe: Creative, eclectic, and expressive—a constantly evolving canvas of urban culture.

landmarks.name: Summit Museum of Contemporary Art (SMoCA)
landmarks.type: The city's premier contemporary art museum, featuring national and local artists

landmarks.name: The Independent Theater Collective
landmarks.type: A collection of small, independent theaters showcasing plays, improv, and experimental performances

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Canvas Lofts
micro_neighborhoods.style: Converted warehouses featuring artist lofts with large windows and open floor plans
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Late-night creativity, gallery hops, a strong sense of artistic community

name: Tubman University Crossing
design_style: Contemporary collegiate brick-and-glass fusion with transit pavilion arches
features: Open-air student plaza flowing directly into platform terraces
Digital orator wall with daily rotating lectures, quotes, and student-designed prompts
Transit-adjacent amphitheater with informal seating for debate circles and public philosophy sessions
Student-run general store kiosk offering snacks, course materials, and club merch
function: Key node serving Tubman University’s main academic campus, student life centers, and daily university commuter needs.

neighborhood.name: Tubman Commons
neighborhood.vibe: Collegiate, high-achieving, radically expressive—where discourse meets generational momentum.

landmarks.name: Tubman Central Library
landmarks.type: Five-story academic and civic resource center with rooftop study groves

landmarks.name: The Agora Hall
landmarks.type: Hybrid lecture/performance/convening arena with modular seating

executive_towers.name: Union Hall
executive_towers.style: Modern mid-rise with study balconies and shared tech lounges

micro_neighborhoods.name: Inquiry Row
micro_neighborhoods.style: Student co-ops and honors dorms along discussion gardens

name: Maplewood Station
design_style: Craftsman-style shelters with timber framing, stone bases, and stained-glass accent windows
features: Platform benches designed as porch swings
A community library book-swap box
Landscaping featuring mature maple trees and seasonal flower beds
Covered, secure bike racks for local commuters
function: Serves a quiet, established suburban residential neighborhood known for its community parks and tree-lined streets.

neighborhood.name: Maplewood Park
neighborhood.vibe: Quiet, family-friendly, and established—a classic suburban neighborhood with a strong sense of community.

landmarks.name: Maplewood Community Park
landmarks.type: A large park with playgrounds, sports fields, and a community center

landmarks.name: The Corner Scoop
landmarks.type: A beloved local ice cream shop and community gathering spot

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Maples
micro_neighborhoods.style: A mix of mid-century ranch homes and newer two-story family homes
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Block parties, kids playing in the street, well-tended gardens

name: Industrial Bridge
design_style: Utilitarian and robust, featuring corrugated steel canopies, reinforced concrete, and wide platforms to accommodate worker shifts
features: Extra-wide staircases and ramps for peak-hour commuter flow
High-visibility safety lighting
Shuttle bus bays for direct connections to specific industrial facilities
A large, iconic bridge structure from which the station gets its name
function: Provides essential transit access for workers in the city's light industrial, warehousing, and logistics district.

neighborhood.name: The Bridge District
neighborhood.vibe: Functional, industrious, and always in motion—a district that works around the clock.

landmarks.name: Summit Logistics Hub
landmarks.type: A large complex of warehouses and distribution centers for regional commerce

landmarks.name: The Worker's Cantina
landmarks.type: A 24-hour diner serving hearty meals to shift workers

name: Eastside Market
design_style: Open-air market hall concept with high ceilings, exposed wood beams, and large garage-style doors that open to the market plaza
features: Platform area seamlessly integrates with the outdoor market space
A large digital 'Community Board' displaying daily vendor specials and neighborhood events
Seating areas made from recycled market crates and barrels
Colorful murals depicting fresh produce and local community leaders
function: Serves a bustling and diverse daily market, a beloved gathering spot for fresh food, artisan goods, and street food.

neighborhood.name: The Market District
neighborhood.vibe: Vibrant, diverse, and delicious—a sensory-rich neighborhood centered around food and community.

landmarks.name: Eastside Community Market
landmarks.type: A large indoor-outdoor market with dozens of vendors selling produce, meats, baked goods, and international street food

landmarks.name: The Spice Merchant's Row
landmarks.type: A collection of small shops selling international spices, groceries, and specialty foods

micro_neighborhoods.name: Market View Lofts
micro_neighborhoods.style: Mixed-use buildings with apartments above ground-floor retail and restaurants
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: The smell of fresh bread and spices, the sound of multiple languages, a lively and bustling atmosphere from morning to night

name: Quincy Lazarus African Heritage Museum
design_style: Contemporary Afrocentric design featuring bold geometric patterns, rich wood tones, and a striking cantilevered roof
features: An open-air plaza with sculptures by prominent Black artists
Station walls inscribed with quotes from Quincy Lazarus and other historical figures
A digital exhibit showcasing the museum's current collections, accessible from the platform
Seamless integration with the museum's main entrance and welcome garden
function: The eastern terminus of the Blue Line, providing direct access to the renowned Quincy Lazarus African Heritage Museum and serving the surrounding community.

neighborhood.name: Lazarus Commons
neighborhood.vibe: Historic, proud, and culturally rich—a neighborhood celebrating its heritage and looking to the future.

landmarks.name: The Quincy Lazarus African Heritage Museum
landmarks.type: A major cultural institution dedicated to preserving and celebrating the history, art, and culture of people of African descent

landmarks.name: The Heritage Market
landmarks.type: A community market featuring food, crafts, and clothing from across the African diaspora

micro_neighborhoods.name: The Sankofa Houses
micro_neighborhoods.style: A mix of historic brick rowhouses and new, modern affordable housing developments
micro_neighborhoods.vibe: Strong community bonds, vibrant street festivals, a deep sense of history and pride
